intro: Lilium nevadense, commonly known as the Nevada lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Lilium nevadense plays an important role in its ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various herbivores.
